page.title: 20Jedburgh's Personalities.
page.content: Roy Laidlaw,the best known man in town,has played rugby 31 times for Scotland.He was a member of the winning 1983/84 Grand Slam team.He has played for the British Lions, Barbarians and Cooptimists.Roy is an electrician in the town.Since achieving fame he has been asked to speak at dinners,help with charities and assist with Sunday School recruitment. Tom Hughes, aged 78,is a well_known fiddler.He learned to play at the age of 7 on his first fiddle made by his father,one of a long line of musicians.He played at kirns and weddings.His music is mainly Scottish country dance music.He is a winner of many competitions. A revival of interest in folk music has given a new lease of life to his playing.
